google_reviews.author: John K. Cummings
google_reviews.review: Liked it so much that I've decided to take a one bedroom apartment here.

google_reviews.author: Pampered Duchess
google_reviews.review: The building itself is fine. It's new and rather well insulated. It's fine as low-income housing. However, it's "tax credit" rather than subsidized housing. The management can't keep janitorial staff, doesn't communicate well, and generally does not address community concerns. It's so bad around here that they basically tore down and rebuilt the Aloha.

google_reviews.author: Vanessa Alexander
google_reviews.review: Nice albeit small brand new apartments. Most Are some type of rent assisted/sliding fee scale ECT. Second building will be getting underway very soon they say, it should be open and people moving in sometime next year is what I've heard.

google_reviews.author: Todd Johnson
google_reviews.review: Tango and I really do love living here ..and Once the buildings are finished... sometime between Spring and the Summer of (2023)..Sammish Commons will be a Stable, Secure, Resident Friendly, Caring Management, little Community within it's own self.. Quality living and a Great location too, literally "everything" you can ask for is within walking distance!.. I'm genuinely happy but just don't know how to identify it sometimes.. lol... Sammish Commons, Thank you for letting us rest our weary heads..

google_reviews.author: Fernando Gonzalez
google_reviews.review: Beautiful piece of architecture in the Samish Urban village, lots of parking, easily accessible, next to Downtown and I-5.

google_reviews.author: Kim Sandberg
google_reviews.review: My friend lives there!  Great place!

google_reviews.author: Cyndi Ackerson
google_reviews.review: I live here and I love it.
